title: WHO Surgical Safety Checklist
description: The World Health Organisation (WHO) first published their Surgical Safety Checklist in 2010. It's a series of five critical steps that surgical teams should perform before and after surgical procedures to reduce the risk of certain adverse events.

beforeInduction.title: Before Induction of Anaesthesia
beforeInduction.description: Complete this section with at least the nurse and anaesthetist.

identityConfirmed.title: Has the patient confirmed his/her identity, site, procedure, and consent?

machineAndMedicationCheck.title: Is the anaesthesia machine and medication check complete?

pulseOximeterFunctioning.title: Is the pulse oximeter on the patient and functioning?

bloodLossRisk.title: Risk of >500ml blood loss (7ml/kg in children)?
enum: Yes, and two IVs/central access and fluids planned

beforeSkinIncision.title: Before Skin Incision
beforeSkinIncision.description: Complete this section with the nurse, anaesthetist and surgeon.

confirmTeamIntroduced.label: Confirm all team members have introduced themselves by name and role.

confirmPatientNameProcedureLocation.label: Confirm the patient's name, procedure and where the incision will be made.

confirmAntibioticProphylaxisGiven.title: Has antibiotic prophylaxis been given within the last 60 minutes?

anticipatedCriticalEventsToSurgeonCritic.label: What are the critical or non-routine steps?

anticipatedCriticalEventsToSurgeonHowLon.label: How long will the case take?

anticipatedCriticalEventsToSurgeonAntici.label: What is the anticipated blood loss?

anticipatedCriticalEventsToNursingTeamSt.label: Has sterility (including indicator results) been confirmed?

anticipatedCriticalEventsToNursingTeamEq.label: Are there equipment issues or any concerns?

beforePatientLeavesOperatingRoom.title: Before Patient Leaves Operating Room
beforePatientLeavesOperatingRoom.description: Complete this section with the nurse, anaesthetist and surgeon.

completionOfInstrumentSpongeAndNeedleCou.label: Completion of instrument, sponge and needle counts

specimenLabelling.label: Specimen labelling (read specimen labels aloud, including patient name)

equipmentProblemsToBeAddressed.label: Whether there are any equipment problems to be addressed

procedureNamed.label: What are the key concerns for recovery and management of this patient?
